Has anyone successfully set up a build process that uses `hs watch` and auto-refreshes the HubSpot site on changes?

Right now our build uses gulp to watch for changes in the dist folder, then uses `hs upload` to individually upload any files that changed, and on successful callback triggers LiveReload to refresh chrome. I would love to use `hs watch` to do watch the files, but I can't figure out how to trigger a refresh when a change is successfully made.

Hi guys, is there a way how to develop HubSpot themes localy? I mean true local development.
FOr example to see the whole project on local machine. Open the page like: localhost/my-project

Sorry, I’m new in local development looking for an advice :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey Andrej, unfortunately, we do not have kind of way to run HubSpot locally on your machine to be able to do that. Right now, best course of action would be doing something similar to this: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/github-integration>
Thank you very much. Just out of curiosity, is there a plan to extend CLI functionality for a local development?

Andrej we’re definitely looking to make developing with the CLI better, and improve the sandbox experience.

CMS Hub is deeply integrated with all of the HubSpot tools. The platform undergoes thousands of updates every day. We want to ensure that when you preview your work, you can know confidently how it will look and act in the absolute latest version of HubSpot. Maintaining a simulated environment that encapsulates the full power and capabilities of HubSpot in it’s entirety and updating it every time a change occurs would make it near impossible for you as a developer to keep up.

There is also some technology that you can’t really test locally, for example image resizing with the HubL `resize_image_url()` function which utilizes our CDN to resize the images. So we don’t feel the local dev experience could be as good as a hybrid approach.

So right now that means our recommended approach is using a CMS Sandbox account to build on then pushing your content to  your production portal once ready.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/creating-an-efficient-development-workflow>


We think there is a lot more we can do to make development easier locally, and we would love to hear your feedback.
